text: Gary Bruce Ruvkun (born 26 March 1952) is an American molecular biologist. He is a professor of genetics at Harvard Medical School in Boston. Ruvkun was elected a Member of the American Philosophical Society in 2019. Ruvkun was awarded the 2024 Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine with Victor Ambros for their discovery of microRNA. ==References== Category:1952 births Category:Living people Category:American molecular biologists Category:Educators from Berkeley, California Category:Scientists from Berkeley, California Category:Writers from Berkeley, California
title: Gary Ruvkun
